newsitem.title: USA: SEC may begin fining localities - former official.
newsitem.headline: SEC may begin fining localities - former official.

text.p: The Securities and Exchange Commission may not have imposed a fine on a state or local government in any of its muni enforcement actions to date, but that trend is likely to end, a former high level SEC enforcement official said Thursday.
Bruce Heiler, currently a lawyer in private practice in Washington D.C., said "if things continue and more cases come, you will see fines against municipal issuers."

The SEC has brought over 20 enforcement actions in the last two years against participants in municipal bond deals. While it has fined bond dealers and financial advisers, it has not levied a fine against municipal government officials.

Heiler also said that if the SEC begins to bring enforcement cases involving "yield burning," the agency is likely to treat them as price markup cases and to seek return of illegal profits, a strategy called "disgorgement." --U.S. Municipal Desk, 212-859-1650
